item.title: Jubilation in South Korea After President Who Declared Martial Law Is Ousted
item.description: The nation’s top court unanimously upheld the impeachment of Yoon Suk Yeol, clearing the way for the election of a new president.

item.title: What Is Next for Yoon Suk Yeol, South Korea’s Ousted President?
item.description: South Korea’s former president still faces criminal charges of leading an insurrection when he declared martial law. If found guilty, he could be impr...

item.title: Trump’s Trade War Escalates as China Retaliates With 34% Tariffs
item.description: The Chinese government said it would match President Trump’s tariff, and also barred a group of American companies from doing business in China.

item.title: India Passes Contentious Bill Increasing Oversight of Muslim Land Trusts
item.description: The legislation passed by Parliament on Friday would allow non-Muslims to help administer so-called Waqfs. The move fueled concerns that the rights of...

item.title: As Unexplained Quakes Ease, Santorini Insists It’s Open for Business
item.description: The Greek island was shaken by thousands of mostly smaller-scale temblors. Now, residents have returned, and they hope visitors will, too.
